name: Mindreaver
text:
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Mindreaver, exile the top three cards of target player's library.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice Mindreaver: Counter target spell with the same name as a card exiled with Mindreaver.

name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.

editions.flavor:
"It saddens me to lose a source of inspiration. This one seemed especially promising."
—Ashiok

"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

—Volrath

name: Minds Aglow
text: Join forces — Starting with you, each player may pay any amount of mana. Each player draws X cards, where X is the total amount of mana paid this way.

name: Mindscour Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Mindscour Dragon deals combat damage to an opponent, target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The bells may one day ring as an anthem of our own end."
—Kyu, Sage-Eye mystic

name: Mind Sculpt
text: Target opponent puts the top seven cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Your mind was a curious mix of madness and genius. I just took away the genius."
—Jace Beleren

"Your mind was a curious mix of madness and genius. I just took away the genius."
—Jace Beleren

name: Mind's Desire
text:
Shuffle your library. Then exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card without paying its mana cost. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

name: Mind's Dilation
text: Whenever an opponent casts his or her first spell each turn, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: Infinite wisdom cannot be contained within a single mind.

name: Mind's Eye
text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Developed and tested by researchers at the Consulate's House of Knowledge, these devices allow anyone to see with a visionary's eye.
"Ideas drift like petals on the wind. I have only to lift my face to the breeze."
"Ideas drift like petals on the wind. I have only to lift my face to the breeze."

name: Mind Shatter
text: Target player discards X cards at random.

editions.flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.

name: Mindshrieker
text:
Flying
{2}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Mindshrieker gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost.

name: Mind Slash
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: "I can't think with all that screaming."
"I can't think with all that screaming."

name: Mindslaver
text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice Mindslaver: You control target player during that player's next turn. (You see all cards that player could see and make all decisions for the player.)

editions.flavor: It's a helm that leaves the head at its most vulnerable.

name: Mindslicer
text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards his or her hand.

editions.flavor: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.
It is the thing that goes bump in the night.

name: Mind Sludge
text: Target player discards a card for each Swamp you control.

editions.flavor: When you get into the swamp, the swamp gets into you.
When you get into the swamp, the swamp gets into you.

"Guard your thoughts. You never know who might wish to take them from you."
—Kalitas, Bloodchief of Ghet

name: Mindsparker
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever an opponent casts a white or blue instant or sorcery spell, Mindsparker deals 2 damage to that player.

name: Mind Spring
text: Draw X cards.

editions.flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.
Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.
Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

name: Mindstab
text:
Target player discards three cards.
Suspend 4—{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {B} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Mindstab Thrull
text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

name: Mindstatic
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {6}.

editions.flavor:
"It's always satisfying to stymie the best efforts of a rival, but the reactions of the Gruul are particularly amusing."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: Mind Stone
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Mind Stone: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power."
—Rene Descartes, Discourse on Method

"Not by age but by capacity is wisdom gained."
—Titus Maccius Plautus, Trinummus

"What is mana but possibility, an idea not yet given form?"
—Jhoira, master artificer

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you had no cards in hand at the beginning of this turn. If you had a card in hand, Mindstorm Crown deals 1 damage to you.

name: Mindswipe
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Mindswipe deals X damage to that spell's controller.

editions.flavor:
"The past and the unwritten are frozen. To understand their meaning requires heat."
—Arel the Whisperer

name: Mind Swords
text:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay Mind Swords's mana cost.
Each player exiles two cards from his or her hand.

name: Mind Twist
text: Target player discards X cards at random.

name: Mind Unbound
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a lore counter on Mind Unbound, then draw a card for each lore counter on Mind Unbound.

editions.flavor: The creations of the hand are confined by reality. The creations of the mind know no such limits.

name: Mind Warp
text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.

editions.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

name: Mindwarper
text:
Mindwarper enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mindwarper: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Mind Whip
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {3}. If he or she doesn't, Mind Whip deals 2 damage to that player and you tap that creature.

editions.flavor: "A mind in agony is a sparrow without wings." —Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Mindwhip Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery."

editions.flavor:
"They share more than their thoughts. We must shatter their link quickly!"
—Hanna, to Orim

name: Mindwrack Demon
text:
Flying, trample
When Mindwrack Demon enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
Delirium — At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 4 life unless there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

name: Mindwrack Liege
text:
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}: You may put a blue or red creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Mine Bearer
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mine Bearer: Destroy target attacking creature.

editions.flavor: "The Keldons may have explosive tempers, but I have explosives."

name: Mine Excavation
text:
Return target artifact or enchantment card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.
Conspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Mine Layer
text:
{1}{R}, {T}: Put a mine counter on target land.
Whenever a land with a mine counter on it becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Mine Layer leaves the battlefield, remove all mine counters from all lands.

name: Mine, Mine, Mine!
text:
When Mine, Mine, Mine comes into play, each player puts his or her library into his or her hand.
Each player skips his or her discard phase and does not lose as a result of being unable to draw a card.
Each player cannot play more than one spell each turn.
If Mine, Mine, Mine leaves play, each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library.

name: Miner's Bane
text: {2}{R}: Miner's Bane gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

editions.flavor: There are certain stones even dwarves know to leave in the earth.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Minion of Leshrac
text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Leshrac deals 5 damage to you unless you sacrifice a creature other than Minion of Leshrac. If Minion of Leshrac deals damage to you this way, tap it.
{T}: Destroy target creature or land.

name: Minion of Tevesh Szat
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {B}{B}.
{T}: Target creature gets +3/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"A minion given over to Tevesh Szat is a stronger minion gained."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Minion of the Wastes
text:
Trample
As Minion of the Wastes enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.
Minion of the Wastes's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.

name: Minion Reflector
text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a token that's a copy of that creature. That token has haste and "At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice this permanent."

editions.flavor: To crack a mirror is to provide an opening for the reflection to escape.

name: Minions' Murmurs
text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"They are quick to offer advice, those whose mistakes doomed them to undeath. How can I not listen to the wisdom of failure?"
—Ratadrabik of Urborg

name: Minister of Impediments
text:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
{T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: When it takes forever to learn all the rules, no time is left for breaking them.

name: Minister of Inquiries
text:
When Minister of Inquiries enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: "This research violates Consulate law."

name: Minister of Pain
text:
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Minister of Pain exploits a creature, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Draconic words need not be shouted. A whisper will suffice.

"Look at that. Shuffling, wobbling, entrails placed haphazardly. It's shameful. Who would let that kind of work flap about for all to see?"
—Lestin, necromancer

name: Minotaur Aggressor
text: First strike, haste

editions.flavor: The smelting district is home to many who see the guilds as not for them.

name: Minotaur Explorer
text: When Minotaur Explorer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

editions.flavor: After the invasion devastated the Talruum and Hurloon tribes, the survivors began to search for other minotaurs.

{1}{U}: Minotaur Illusionist gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
{R}, Sacrifice Minotaur Illusionist: Minotaur Illusionist deals damage equal to its power to target creature.

text:
Haste

editions.flavor:

Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: "Those wings are no advantage. I will pin them to the ceiling of the Hekma."

text:
Haste
Minotaur Tactician gets +1/+1 as long as you control a white creature.
Minotaur Tactician gets +1/+1 as long as you control a blue creature.

editions.flavor: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

name: Miracle Worker
text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.

editions.flavor: "Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul." —Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints

name: Miraculous Recovery
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: "I am the rock of the polis. Death only strengthens me."

"You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

name: Mirari
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor: Even after a false god tore the magic from Dominaria, power still radiated from the Mirari sword that slew her.
The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.

text:
Enchant creature

editions.flavor:
"Is there anything in Guul Draz that doesn't suck the life out of you?"
—Tarsa, Sea Gate sell-sword

name: Mire Boa
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{G}: Regenerate Mire Boa.

editions.flavor: Mire slime courses through its veins in place of blood. No sooner does it bleed than it opens its mouth to replace the loss.

name: Mire Kavu
text: Mire Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.

editions.flavor: "At this rate," said Sisay, "the next kavu we see will have wings."

name: Miren, the Moaning Well
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

name: Mire Shade
text: {B}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mire Shade. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor:

—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Mire's Malice
text:
Target opponent discards two cards.
Awaken 3—{5}{B} (If you cast this spell for {5}{B}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

text: Target player reveals a number of cards from his or her hand equal to the number of Swamps you control. You choose one of them. That player discards that card.

editions.flavor: As the bridge snapped, Berko was sure he heard the swamp laughing at him.

name: Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker
text:
Flying
Whenever Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals four land cards, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.

name: Mirozel
text:
Flying
When Mirozel becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Mirozel to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.

text: Double strike, protection from black and from green

A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

name: Mirran Mettle
text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

name: Mirran Spy
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.

editions.flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

name: Mirri
text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.

editions.flavor: Mirri and Gerrard have been the best of friends since they trained together under the maro-sorcerer Multani. A fierce and agile warrior, she rejoined Gerrard aboard the Weatherlight as his unofficial first mate shortly after he assumed command of the flying ship.

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

editions.flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

name: Mirri's Guile
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.

name: Mirri the Cursed
text:
Flying, first strike, haste
Whenever Mirri the Cursed deals combat damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on Mirri the Cursed.

editions.flavor: A hero fails, a martyr falls. Time twists and destinies interchange.

name: Mirri the Cursed Avatar
text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a charge counter on Mirrodin's Core.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Mirrodin's Core: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Mirrored Depths
text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player flips a coin. If he or she loses the flip, counter that spell.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, target player reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

name: Mirror Entity
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

editions.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.
Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

text: {X}: Choose a creature type. Until end of turn, creatures you control of the chosen type have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

editions.flavor: LRW Prize Avatar

name: Mirror Gallery
text: The "legend rule" doesn't apply.

editions.flavor: Only in mirrors do heroes find their equal.

name: Mirror Golem
text:
Imprint — When Mirror Golem enters the battlefield, you may exile target card from a graveyard.
Mirror Golem has protection from each of the exiled card's card types. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)

name: Mirror-Mad Phantasm
text:
Flying
{1}{U}: Mirror-Mad Phantasm's owner shuffles it into his or her library. If that player does, he or she reveals cards from the top of that library until a card named Mirror-Mad Phantasm is revealed. The player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

name: Mirror Match
text:
Cast Mirror Match only during the declare blockers step.
For each creature attacking you or a planeswalker you control, create a token that's a copy of that creature and that's blocking that creature. Exile those tokens at end of combat.

name: Mirror Mirror
text:
Mirror Mirror comes into play tapped.
{7}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Mirror: At end of turn, exchange life totals with target player and exchange all cards in play that you control, and all cards in your hand, library, and graveyard, with that player until end of game.

name: Mirror Mockery
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, you may create a token that's a copy of that creature. Exile that token at end of combat.

editions.flavor: Who you are constantly runs toward who you will be.

name: Mirror of Fate
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror of Fate: Choose up to seven face-up exiled cards you own. Exile all the cards from your library, then put the chosen cards on top of your library.

editions.flavor: As the glass shattered, forgotten realities and dead memories came flooding back.

name: Mirrorpool
text:
Mirrorpool enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}{C}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirrorpool: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy.
{4}{C}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirrorpool: Create a token that's a copy of target creature you control.

name: Mirror Sheen
text: {1}{U/R}{U/R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: Even treefolk witches steer clear of the unpredictable woods near Glen Elendra. Spells refract off the glamer-polished trees and the eyes of lurking pucas.

name: Mirror-Sigil Sergeant
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a blue permanent, you may create a token that's a copy of Mirror-Sigil Sergeant.

editions.flavor: "If I had many lives, I would give them all for Bant."

name: Mirror Strike
text: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn by target unblocked creature is dealt to its controller instead.

editions.flavor:

—The Teachings of Zho

text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Universe: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

editions.flavor:
